title: Step 1 – Project Overview
content:
Welcome to the **Next.js 14 + TypeScript To-Do App Workshop**!

In this hands-on activity, you will progressively build a complete **To-Do List Application** using the App Router. Each step introduces a new concept: project setup, components, state, styling, and deployment. This is the essence of *Learning by Doing*.

title: Step 2 – Setup Environment
content:
Ensure your system is ready:

1️⃣ Install **Node.js v18+ (LTS)** from [nodejs.org](https://nodejs.org)
2️⃣ Use a modern editor like **VS Code**.
3️⃣ Check your versions:
explain: Always use an LTS (Long-Term Support) version for stability and compatibility.

title: Step 3 – Create a New Project
content:
Let’s scaffold your project:

Open your terminal and run:
code:
npx create-next-app@latest next-todo --typescript --eslint --app
cd next-todo
npm run dev

title: Step 4 – Understand the Structure
content: You should now see this structure:
code:
app/
  layout.tsx
  page.tsx
  globals.css
components/
  TodoList.tsx
explain: The **app/** folder contains your routes and layouts. The **components/** folder will contain reusable UI parts.

title: Step 5 – Create the To-Do List Component
content: Now let’s build your first **interactive React component** using **React state** and **Tailwind CSS**. Inside the `components` folder, create a new file named **`TodoList.tsx`** and paste:

title: Step 5.5 – Display the Component in the App
content:
Now that you’ve built the `TodoList` component, you need to display it on the main page.

Open **`app/page.tsx`** and import your component:
explain: The `app/page.tsx` file represents your home route (`/`). Importing `TodoList` here makes it appear as the main page of your app.

title: Step 6 – Install Animation and Icon Libraries
content: To make your To-Do List more dynamic and attractive, install **Framer Motion** (for animations) and **Lucide React** (for icons).
explain: Framer Motion adds smooth animations; Lucide React provides modern SVG icons.

title: Step 7 – Build the Professional To-Do List UI
content: Now upgrade your To-Do List with animations, icons, and persistent data using **localStorage**.

title: Step 8 – Deploy and Reflect
content:
You’re done! Deploy by pushing to GitHub and connecting to [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

You now understand the full workflow:
**Scaffold → Code → Style → Persist → Deploy.**
